divs: sighting detailsi had left oakland around 11:00 pm for a night drive back to new mexico. after leaving the i-5 on california state highway 46 between lost hills and wasco, around 2:00 am, i saw lights that appeared just like the lights at the end of wings of a 737 or 747 airliner. they were fairly low to the ground, especially for a large airliner...maybe 100 feet up, and i was not aware of any sizeable airports in the area. the lights were solid white, and there was one at either end, and then one in the middle (looked just like the lights at the tips of an airliner's wings and one on the main fuselage itself). what caught my attention is that the object then rotated itself 180 degrees, as if the plane did half a barrel-roll and was now flying upside-down. this was a slow rotate...took probably 3-5 seconds. the object then dipped lower to the ground. when i was at a vantage point to see the object again (about 10 seconds later) it had vanished. i then saw lights of the same configuration quite a ways away in the same direction. a few minutes later, i saw the same set of lights again. this time, however, they were much closer to the freeway, and on the opposite side. the object maneuvered slightly in the air, and the white lights on the end of the wings must have lined up and shone right at me for a brief moment, as if i were simply in its line-of-sight for a brief moment as in maneuvered...not as if it was necessarily done intentionally. these lights were very bright, however...not enough to cause any kind of disorientation or loss of vision, but definitely brighter than any light i've ever seen on an aircraft...especially from that distance (probably a 1\4 mile or so). this object then did the same slow 180-degree flip. this time, there was a bit of ambient light beneath the craft. as it flipped, you could see an obvious triangle-shaped body. the middle light did not look to be on the main fuselage, but on the 3rd corner instead. each of the 3 lights appeared to be coming from a recessed area on each of the three corners, and the lights looked to cover a large circular area. each "light" was probably about 5-10 feet around. the object then dipped lower to the surface, as did the first object, and out of view.
